title: After Loss to Cristiano Ronaldoâ€™s Al Nassr, Al Ittihad Star Punished With Hefty Fine by Disciplinary Committee - EssentiallySports
text:
Karim Benzema â€˜s side isnâ€™t at its best on the domestic front. Tuesdayâ€™s 2-5 loss against Cristiano Ronaldo and Co. added more to their misery. But it seems the storm clouds wonâ€™t be going away easily, as hours after their shocking defeat against Al Nassr, one Al Ittihad star has found himself in the crosshairs of the disciplinary committee, resulting in a substantial fine.
Americaâ€™s Favorite Video Today
The player who is currently in the negative limelight is Abderrazak Hamdallah . The Al Ittihad centre forward has been sent a fine notice by the Saudi Pro League disciplinary committee. After the heavy defeat, the 33-year-old was expected to give a post-match interview. However, Hamdallah snubbed the media obligations, heading straight to the tunnel instead. This led the committee to penalize him with a 20,000 riyals, or a $5333 fine.

Notably, Hamdallah was the one who notched two goals for Al Ittihad, outshining star player Karim Benzema . Sadly, Cristiano Ronaldoâ€™s penalty double, Anderson Taliscaâ€™s strike, and Sadio Maneâ€™s brace sent the strikerâ€™s efforts in vain. Things had gone downhill for Al Ittihad as Fabinho was sent off in the 66th minute. With 28 points and sixth place, it is evident that the defending champions wonâ€™t be celebrating their New Year in high spirits.
Al Nassr came into this match with a terrible head-to-head record. They hadnâ€™t won against this opposition since December 21, 2018, and their winless run had lasted eleven games. However, they finally managed to break the five-year spell . On the other hand, the aftermath had a depressing effect on Benzema.

Karim Benzema suspends his digital footprint after taking a beating from Cristiano Ronaldo and Co. After the game, keen-eyed fans observed the disappearance of Karim Benzemaâ€™s Instagram account. The prolific striker, who had garnered an impressive 76 million followers, has opted to deactivate his account entirely . The specific rationale behind this decision remains undisclosed, with the French striker choosing not to provide any explanation regarding the move.

Coincidentally, this happened after the defeat against his former Real Madrid teammateâ€™s side. Additionally, the 36-year-old also became the target of his fanbase , who nicknamed him â€œBen-Hazima,â€ meaning â€œthe son of defeat.â€ Furthermore, Al Ittihad boss Marcelo Gallardo was even slammed for starting the 2022 Ballon dâ€™Or winner. It seems things have completely gone south for Benzema. Letâ€™s hope the new year turns out well for the Frenchman.
